alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Somerset County through 245 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bingham, or 21 miles northwest of Skowhegan, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bingham, Embden, Brighton Plantation, Concord, Mayfield, Moscow, Pleasant Ridge Plantation, and Bald Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Maine.
